ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Daniel Maynard  Good TA with confidence in data analysis and R software, and can provide good comments.
Instructor: Daniel Maynard  Dan was very helpful and knowledgeable.
Instructor: Daniel Maynard  dan
Instructor: Daniel Maynard  Very helpful and responsible.
Instructor: Daniel Maynard  Daniel Maynard

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I got more out of the class from the TA. He explained this much clearer than the professor. We need more real world examples of stats and regressions and related concepts. I did not feel connected to how this was actually used in research or how to apply it to my own.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: R software
getting more comfortable with R
The assignment is well designed and the class size is very good.

Simple linear regression and the fact that instructor do not strictly attached to a particular conceptual ideas. The fact that there are many exemplary scripts and resources available on the site for further practice.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: The course must be more technical with a lot of exercises to allow student understanding the materials. The professor must also be able to test if students' ability by asking some questions during the lecture. The course must be interactive rather than setting and listening the professor.
The professor is not aware whether the students are understanding the material or not.
instruction, homeworks, connecting theory to real examples of how it is used in scientific publications

the class could be more interactive to know how students following instructions. This could easily clarify the confusion with students. A confused student may not ask the right questions to start with.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Daniel Maynard  He was really good.
Instructor: Daniel Maynard  Dan did a good job at explaining the subject simply. He was responsive to email and was willing to meet outside of office hours
Instructor: Daniel Maynard  Dan is awesome! He spent a lot of time explaining to me what I did not understand with Tim's explanations.

Instructor: Daniel Maynard  Dan was excellent on tutorials. However, he should be more patient as all students do not have same computing backgrounds and that speed increases automatically with constant practice in everything.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I thought this would be related to me research, but I don't think I will end up using it that much.
This course prepares me with some background information for my graduate thesis project.
I would use regression analysis in my thesis research

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: My research is based on regression modeling.

The help me understand modeling; but I did not get much out of it. I would have gotten more out of rueining sherer or os schmitz's course, because i think i would have learnedmore about r and modeling, and maybe even more about regressions.
I'd like to go deep in the regression models and apply the related knowledge into my own project.
To understand and learn to build models for predicting some environmental phenomena

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Hopefully.
No, I feel only vaguely more comfortably with the subject.
Not really- I already knew most of this stuff from taking a higher level biostatistics course in undergrad. I should have just skipped straight to spatial stats or taken another course.
Yes.
Yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: N/A

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Students who are interested in research and academia should consider taking the class.
Think about taking multi-variate or Os's modeling course. You will probabaly learn more and be less frustrated.
Take some intro-level course first
The course is good but students will get the most of the class if they preparing for the class by reading lecture notes. In that case, they can follow critically and know when they fall short.
